definitions.text: two-winged insects characterized by active flight
flap consisting of a piece of canvas that can be drawn back to provide entrance to a tent
an opening in a garment that is closed by a zipper or by buttons concealed under a fold of cloth
(baseball) a hit that flies up in the air
fisherman's lure consisting of a fishhook decorated to look like an insect
travel through the air; be airborne

examples: We fly flowers from the Caribbean to North America

definitions.text: change quickly from one emotional state to another

examples: she is flying to Cincinnati tonight

definitions.text: display in the air or cause to float
examples: All nations fly their flags in front of the U.N.
He threw down his gun and fled

definitions.text: travel over (an area of land or sea) in an aircraft
examples: Lindbergh was the first to fly the Atlantic
the money vanished in las Vegas
all my stock assets have vaporized
